thread.title: Sports Roundup: Hendrix volleyball, soccer and cross country; Greenbrier volleyball; CBC soccer
thread.title_full: Sports Roundup: Hendrix volleyball, soccer and cross country; Greenbrier volleyball; CBC soccer

author: Staff
title: Sports Roundup: Hendrix volleyball, soccer and cross country; Greenbrier volleyball; CBC soccer
text:
Sports Roundup: Hendrix volleyball, soccer and cross country; Greenbrier volleyball; CBC soccer Posted: October 12, 2015 - 7:56pm LOG CABIN DEMOCRAT 
JACKSON, Miss. — The Hendrix College volleyball team overcame a 2-0 deficit in sets to defeat Millsaps College at the Hangar Dome Sunday afternoon. 
The Warriors topped the Majors, 22-25, 21-25, 25-19, 25-23, 15-13 to move to 15-6 and remain perfect with a 9-0 record in Southern Athletic Association play. Millsaps falls to 10-10 overall and 4-5 in conference. 
Sophomore right side Lauren Petrisin led the Warriors with 19 kills. Sophomore middle blocker Sara Dyslin connected on 14 kills, seven blocks and nine digs. CONWAY VOLLEYBALL 
Conway’s volleyball tram lost to Nettleton, 26-24, 14-25, 15-11, Saturday in the opening round of championship play in the Gold Bracket of the 24-team Lady Cat Invitational. 
In pool play, the Lady Cats (24-5, 9-2) defeated Pulaksi Academy, 25-13, 25-17, then lost to Batesville, 25-22, 25-19 
Mackenzie Dear led with 17 kills and Morgan Mourot added 28 assists, three aces. Payton Lindsey had 18 digs and Aly Brinkley, eight blocks. 
Cabot defeated Nettleton for the Gold Brcket title. Shiloh Christian downed Jonesboro for the Silver Bracket title. Brookland defeated Pulaski Academy for the Bronze Bracket championship. 
Conway will host senior night against Van Buren Tuesday HENDRIX SOCCER 
SEWANEE, Tenn. — Freshman forward Daniel Sweeney scored 1:13 into the second overtime to give the Hendrix College men’s soccer team a 3-2 come-from-behind win at Sewanee-The University of the South on Sunday afternoon. 
Sunday’s game was the sixth time the Warriors went to double overtime this year, and it was their first win in extra time. They improve to 2-7-3 on the year and 1-2-1 in Southern Athletic Association play. The 
Tigers drop to 5-8-1 and 1-3. 
The Tigers (7-3-2, 3-0-1) won the women’s game, 2-0 The Warriors fell to 8-5-1, 1-3. GREENBRIER VOLLEYBALL 
Greenbrier’s volleyball team lost to Farmington and Vilonia last week to fgall to 16-7, 7-4. 
Vilonia won, 25-21, 25-18, 22-25, 25-23. Kobi Hartman had 41 assists for the Panthers. Katherine Jene had 22 kills and three acs. Harlie Langston added 17 kills. Maranda Clenedin led on defense. 
Greenbrier won the JV match, 25-19, 25-22. Katie Love, Andie Finley and Carrie Jo Harville were defensive leaders. 
Farmington won, 25-18, 27-25, 25-17. Hartman had 27 assists. Langston hd 14 kills. Jeane had 10 kills. 
Greenbrier won the JV game, 25-16, 25-21. UCA MEN’S GOLF 
BATON ROUGE, La. — The University of Central Arkansas men’s golf team finished 11th on Sunday at the LSU David Toms Intercollegiate played at The University Club. 
UCA shots rounds of 307-314-301-922. LSU topped the field at 864, followed by Kansas State (880), Liberty (886), Iowa (890), Louisiana-Lafayette (900), Southeastern Louisiana (908), Iowa State and Penn (910), DePaul (911), Louisiana Tech (912), UCA (922), Navy (929), Southern Illinois (936) and ULM (939). 
For the Bears, junior Brad Lamb tied for 28th place, shooting 74-80-74-228. Freshman Luis Obiols tied for 33rd at 74-80-75-229, while sophomore Rodrigo Rivas was 47th (78-77-77-232). Freshman Lewis George tied for 64th place (81-84-75-240) and freshman Alvaro Carol was 72nd (85-77-84-246). HENDRIX TRACK 
CLARKSVILLE, Ark. - The Hendrix College men’s and women’s cross country teams set several season-best marks at the University of the Ozarks Invitational on Saturday morning. 
All six runners for the Warrior women had their best 5K times of the season, as Hendrix placed ninth with 229 points. Junior Dani Ramirez-Aguilar paced the Warriors with a time of 21:24.4, finishing 32nd. Sophomore Joy Spence was 53rd in 22:58.0 and freshman Melissa Pizza shaved off more than two minutes off her previous best, coming in at 23:04.2 in 55th. Freshman Rebecca Levin improved by nearly four minutes with a time of 24:16.6, placing 62nd. Sophomore Sarah Walker finished 69th in 25:25.6. 
Only four men competed for the Warriors on the 8K course. Freshman Nathan Andress improved his previous best by nearly nine seconds. with a mark of 27:46.4, finishing 24th. Junior Cameron Meek was 28th in 28:05.8 and freshman Sam Byrd improved by 1:38 with a time of 33:43.1, finishing 58th. Freshman Joshua Beggs placed 66th in 36:55.9. CBC SOCCER 
Shelby Hammett of ConWAY scored two goals in helping Williams Baptist to a 4-3 overtime soccer victory last week over the Central Baptist College women. 
Tarra Hendricks scored three goals for CBC.
